step1.sentence: I decided to reach out to my old college friend after seeing her post online.

step2.story: Mina had been struggling with a big project at work for weeks. She finally decided to reach out to a former colleague who had experience in the field. That one phone call changed everything and gave her the direction she needed.

step3.story: Jake stared at his phone for the third time that evening, scrolling past the same contact name. He and David had been best friends through high school, but a stupid argument five years ago had ended everything. Now, hearing that David was going through a rough divorce, Jake felt a pull he couldn't ignore. He took a deep breath and decided to reach out with a simple text: 'Hey, I heard what's going on. I'm here if you need to talk.' Within seconds, the typing indicator appeared. Sometimes all it takes is one person brave enough to break the silence.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 직역하면 '손을 뻗다'라는 뜻으로, 물리적으로 팔을 뻗는 동작을 나타냅니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 누군가에게 연락하거나 도움을 요청할 때 사용합니다. 특히 오랜만에 연락하거나, 도움이 필요해서 먼저 다가가는 뉘앙스가 강합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'reach'(닿다, 뻗다)와 'out'(바깥으로)의 결합으로, 물리적으로 손을 뻗는 행위에서 비유적으로 '누군가에게 다가가다/연락하다'라는 의미로 확장되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 '연락하다'보다 적극적이고 따뜻한 느낌이 있습니다. 도움을 주거나 받기 위해, 또는 관계를 회복하기 위해 먼저 다가가는 뉘앙스를 담고 있어 비즈니스와 일상 모두에서 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Don't hesitate to reach out if you need any help.
